snippet: A federal judge heard Christopher M. Coke’s assertion that he was “a good person,” but gave him 23 years in prison.
abstract: Jamaican drug lord Christopher M Coke is sentenced to 23 years in prison, the maximum he faced after pleading guilty to charges including racketeering conspiracy; Coke admitted to leading an organization called the Presidential Click, which distributed crack cocaine and other drugs in Jamaica and the United States, and also obtained guns from the United States for his 200 armed gang members.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge heard Christopher M. Coke’s assertion that he was “a good person,” but gave him 23 years in prison.

headline.seo: Jamaican Drug Lord, Christopher Coke, Is Sentenced to Prison
headline.main: Jamaican Drug Lord Gets Maximum Term
headline.print_headline: Jamaican Drug Lord Gets Maximum Term
